result.execSummary:
The defendant Jakob B Lied was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Straight time if imposed.  Sentence credit of 1 day was granted.
*Defendant may petition for early release from probation, with Agent approval.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Obtain all prescriptions through one source.  
  Comply with aftercare plan. 
  AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
  Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.'s
  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
  Maintain employment and/or school combination.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

8/10/2017 - COURT MODIFIES CONDITIONS TO NO AODA ASSESSMENT AND TREATMENT ORDERED AS PART OF PROBATION CONDITION.

timeConds.notes: To be performed as a condition of probation.

**Reviewed by Judge Michael J. Aprahamian on 8/9/17.**

From Atty Weathers dated 8/8/17 requesting amendment to JOC.
**Reviewed by Judge Michael J. Aprahamian on 8/9/17; Amend JOC to reflect no AODA assessment and treatment ordered as part of probation.**
Filed by Court Reporter, Lori Boyer - from Sentencing Hearing held on 07/19/17.

Defendant Jakob B Lied in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern and ADA Andrea Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for sentencing hearing. Defendant has graduated the Drug Treatment Court. Amended information filed by the State. Count #1 has been amended. ADA Will makes sentencing recommendation. Atty Weathers makes sentencing recommendation. Carl R makes statements of behalf of the Defendant. Robert L (father) makes statements on behalf of the Defendant. Defendant makes statements. The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

COUNT#1 OF AMENDED INFORMATION:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

30 DAYS JAIL, STRAIGHT TIME (CREDIT - 1 days)

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.'s ; ;
____Obtain all prescriptions through one source;
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____40 Hours of Community Service (Alumni meeting will count toward this)
____Comply with aftercare plan
____Defendant may petition for early release from probation, with probation agent approval

COSTS:  $243.00 + $200 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation) 9 days alternate for non payment

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department

Defendant Jakob B Lied in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   Andrea Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   The Court quashes the previously stayed capias.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1. Court accepts plea as, knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily made. Court withholds entry of judgment as the defendant has been accepted into DTC. Court approves the Waukesha County DTC Diversion Contract and forwards the file to DTC.  Count #2 is dismissed and read into Count #1.  Defendant is to report to WCS immediately following court to get set up for treatment court.
